intro: Rinorea woermanniana, commonly known as the woolly rinorea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Rinorea woermanniana is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
